page.title: 09FESTIVAL OF DIVALI
page.content: Divali is celebrated in late october or early November by Hindus and Sikhs. It is the Festival of Light. There is a story behind Divali about Rama and Sita. It is celebrated for their homecoming from the forest after 14 years. The old king, Rama's father, had three wives and three sons. Rama was to be the next King. One of the wives wanted her son to be King so either Lakshman the Queen's son became king or Rama. Rama and his bride Sita were banished into the forest for 14 years. Rama went hunting in the forest Sita was left in a magic circle. One day Ravana a wicked king came and took Sita away. Rama asked Hunuman the monkey king to help him. They beat Ravana and went back to their kingdom and ruled wisely.
